meanings.definition: The action or process of adhering to a surface or object.
meanings.sent1: The adhesion of the sticker to the paper was strong.
meanings.sent2: The glue showed excellent adhesion to the wood.
meanings.sent3: The adhesion of the tape to the cat's fur made for a funny situation.
meanings.sent4: The adhesion of the magnet to the fridge was like a bond that couldn't be broken.
meanings.sent5: The adhesion of the bandage to the skin was so tight, it stayed in place all day.

meanings.definition: A condition in which different parts of the same body are abnormally united.
meanings.sent1: The adhesion between the fingers made it hard to separate them.
meanings.sent2: The surgical procedure aimed to correct the adhesion between the tissues.
meanings.sent3: The adhesion of the two toes caused some awkward moments while walking.
meanings.sent4: The adhesion of the muscles felt like they were working together as one.
meanings.sent5: The adhesion of the skin layers created a strong connection that needed to be addressed by the doctor.
